result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Sanchez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $1800.00   and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBAITON. TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber & Work Crew allowed, but deft is not eligible for an Electronic Leg Monitor. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.  Credit for 74 days.

records.addlTxt: Court has reviewed Atty Koesser's Petition for Relief and petition is DENIED; Sec 973.155(4) Wis Stat applies to inmates "serving sentences".  The DE was not serving a sentence when he was serving time as a condition of probation.  This order is final for purposes of appeal.
for Relief from Inaccurate Sentence Credit Determination filed by Atty Koesser.
Court has reviewed letter received from DE and there is no motion pending before the court and so the court takes no action.

Court has reviewed letter received from DE and the retail theft sentence is consecutive to the OWI sentence so court takes no action.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Count 3 - Defendant is sentenced to 1 year in the Kenosha County Jail forthwith.  Credit for 197 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Civil Judgment ordered for any unpaid financial obligations that still remain at revocation.  Appeal Rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Counts 1 and 3 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 4, 5 and 6 - Dismissed and Read In.  Sentencing arguments made.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.
Count 1 -  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs including DNA surcharge and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.   
Count 3 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions concurrent with 15CM74.  As a condition court imposes 180 days in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 74 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for an Electronic Leg Monitor.    Court imposes a fine of $1800 plus costs and DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 30 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given.
